title.narrative: Strategic Sector Cooperation: Food - Kenya, Improved Food Safety, Quality and Value Addition in the Dairy and Horticulture Sectors, Phase II

description.narrative:
The Strategic Sector Cooperation on Food is a peer-to-peer cooperation between the Danish Veterinary and Food Administration and the Kenyan Ministry of Agriculture Livestock, Fisheries and Irrigation. The cooperation will strengthen Kenya’s food quality control system through a national change of paradigm from control of food to control of food business operators. A Strategic Sector Cooperation (SSC) is a partnership aiming at improving sector framework conditions in a partner country. The initiative is a flexible and adaptive instrument for exchanging experiences, learning and capacity building, which builds on a consolidated strong relationship and trust between the involved authorities. The commitment to finance the Danish authorities’ participation is sequenced in phases; an inception phase of approximately one year resulting in a project document; followed by phase one, two and –if need be – a phase three during which the cooperation is deepened and developed. All SSC partnerships are supported by a sector advisor at the embassy, who impel progress and stir the partnership in the direction agreed upon.
Annually, the SSC projects deliver a report on project progress and results achieved. Progress on selected outputs are displayed in openaid.

title.narrative: Not applicable as baseline, impact indicators are not defined for current SSC projects.
